document_title: Nephrotic syndrome: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Nephrotic syndrome is a condition in which the body loses protein through urine > 3g of protein/day. The cause is glomerular damage accompanied by edema and hypoalbuminemia. This syndrome is more common in children, and has both primary and secondary causes. (first)
Nephrotic syndrome is caused by glomerular damage accompanied by edema and hypoalbuminemia
